createFunction.title: 创建新函数
createFunction.functionNameHelp: AWS 格式：1-64 个字符，字母/数字/下划线/连字符。
createFunction.handlerHelp: 使用当前运行时的 AWS 处理程序格式。
createFunction.resourceLimitsHelp: 配置 CPU、磁盘 I/O 和网络带宽。设为 0 表示无限制。
createFunction.networkPolicyHelp: 在创建时配置入站/出站策略。
createFunction.compilingMessage: 正在编译您的函数，请稍候…
createFunction.compiledMessage: 编译成功！您的函数已可使用。
createFunction.validationNameFormat: 函数名称必须符合 AWS 格式：1-64 个字符，仅允许字母/数字/下划线/连字符。
createFunction.validationMemoryRange: 内存必须在 128 到 10240 MB 之间（AWS Lambda 范围）。
createFunction.validationTimeoutRange: 超时必须在 1 到 900 秒之间（AWS Lambda 范围）。
createFunction.validationJavaHandler: Java/Kotlin/Scala 的处理程序格式必须为 '<package>.<Class>::<method>'。
createFunction.validationCompiledHandler: 编译型运行时的处理程序格式必须是可执行入口名称（字母/数字/_-/）。
createFunction.validationDefaultHandler: 处理程序格式必须为 AWS 风格 '<module>.<function>'（示例：'main.handler'）。
createFunction.depsHelp: 通过 {file} 添加外部依赖。它们将在部署时自动安装。

functionsPage.importInvalidFormat: 导入文件中未找到有效的函数定义。
functionsPage.importInvalidFields: 导入失败：文件格式无效或缺少必填字段。
functionsPage.importResult: 导入完成：{succeeded} 个成功，{failed} 个失败{suffix}。

loginPage.testUsersDescription: Use these accounts to test tenant visibility and switching.

runs.empty: No runs yet. Trigger a run to get started.

triggerDialog.inputHint: Input JSON to pass to root nodes:

apiDocsSharedPage.documentNotFound: The requested document was not found.
apiDocsSharedPage.generatedBy: Generated by Nova AI · Shared on {date}

docsApiDomainPage.endpointIndexDescription: Each endpoint has a dedicated contract page with request/response fields, status codes, and examples.
docsApiDomainPage.leftSidebarHint: Endpoint hierarchy is also available in the left sidebar for direct navigation.

docsApiOperationsPage.title: Operations API
docsApiOperationsPage.description: Operational observability and probe endpoints for health, metrics, logs, and recent invocations.
docsApiOperationsPage.coverageDescription: This section documents runtime health and observability endpoints used by dashboards and SRE workflows.

docsApiOverviewPage.title: API Overview
docsApiOverviewPage.description: Nova API is contract-first and tenant-scoped. Use this page for protocol rules, then open per-endpoint contracts from the left sidebar.

items.tenantAware: Tenant-aware routing and persistence on every request

headersAuth.title: Headers & Auth
headersAuth.description: Explicit tenant headers are recommended for every write and operator workflow.

errorFormat.title: Error Format
errorFormat.description: Most handlers return plain-text errors; some middleware returns structured JSON errors.

items.subscriptionReplay: Event subscriptions support replay and seek from sequence/time anchors.
items.deliveryRetry: Delivery pipelines use bounded retry with backoff and DLQ transitions.

referenceSections.title: Reference Sections
referenceSections.description: Detailed endpoint contracts are split by domain for easier maintenance and faster lookup.

endpointIndex.title: Endpoint Index
endpointIndex.description: Frequently used endpoints across all API domains.

docsArchitecturePage.title: Architecture
docsArchitecturePage.description: Nova is designed as a backend service with clear control-plane and data-plane boundaries, durable state, and asynchronous workers for reliable delivery.

backendFirst.label: Backend-first
backendFirst.value: Nova is the execution and control backend; Orbit and Lumen are clients.

oneControlPlane.label: One control plane
oneControlPlane.value: Functions, workflows, events, and governance share the same API surface.

durability.label: Durability by default
durability.value: Metadata and delivery state are persisted in Postgres.

transparency.label: Operational transparency
transparency.value: Health, metrics, logs, and replay APIs are first-class endpoints.

syncInvocationFlow.title: Sync Invocation Flow
syncInvocationFlow.description: The synchronous path is optimized for predictable latency with pool reuse and clear backpressure behavior.

eventWorkflowDelivery.title: Event + Workflow Delivery
eventWorkflowDelivery.description: Event subscriptions can target functions or workflows. For workflow subscriptions, a webhook may optionally push final outputs externally.

items.item2: Auth-bound identities can only access allowed scopes.
items.item3: Store queries are tenant/namespace filtered to prevent data bleed.
items.item4: Quotas are enforced per tenant for invocations, queue depth, and event publish dimensions.

retries.label: Retries with backoff
retries.value: Async invocations, event deliveries, and outbox jobs all use bounded attempts and exponential-style backoff.

dlq.label: DLQ semantics
dlq.value: Terminal failures move to DLQ where operators can replay or retry.

replay.label: Replay & seek
replay.value: Subscriptions support replay from sequence/time and cursor reset.

idempotency.label: Idempotency
idempotency.value: Async invocation API supports idempotency key + TTL to avoid duplicate work.

docsCliPage.title: Orbit CLI
docsCliPage.description: Orbit is the primary CLI for Nova operations. Nova binary now runs backend services only (daemon mode).

novaBinary.label: Nova binary
novaBinary.value: Backend service process only, run with

orbitCli.label: Orbit CLI
orbitCli.value: Full operational surface for functions, workflows, events, tenants, secrets, metrics, and gateway.

globalContext.title: Global Context
globalContext.description: Orbit resolves target server and tenant scope from flags, environment variables, or local config.

taskRecipes.title: Task Recipes
taskRecipes.description: Use these as copy-paste starters for common operator workflows.

pullLocalTest.title: Pull & Local Test
pullLocalTest.description: Orbit can pull remote function source to local workspace and run a local test with your payload. If runtime toolchain is missing, Orbit prints install instructions directly.

items.item1: Auto local runner currently supports Python and Node.js runtimes.
items.item2: Go/Rust/Java runtimes still pull source and check toolchain, then show manual test guidance.

items.item1Prefix: If commands fail with scope errors, set
items.item3: If create/invoke succeeds but metrics look empty, check the selected tenant badge in Lumen.
items.item4Prefix: For noisy output in automation, use

docsInstallationPage.title: Installation
docsInstallationPage.description: Linux x86_64 zero-to-service installation guide based on scripts/setup.sh. Includes full build flow, deployment modes, and component responsibilities.

beforeYouBegin.title: Before You Begin
beforeYouBegin.description: The one-click script targets Linux x86_64 servers and expects prebuilt Nova binaries.
beforeYouBegin.dataSafetyBodyPrefix: performs a fresh deployment and recreates the
beforeYouBegin.dataSafetyBodySuffix: database. Existing data will be removed.

deploymentModes.title: Deployment Modes
deploymentModes.description: Nova supports two practical installation modes:

modeA.label: Mode A (Docker Dev)
modeA.value: Fastest local development path, containerized stack.

devModeDocker.title: Mode A: Docker Dev
devModeDocker.description: Use this when you need a quick local environment for feature work and docs browsing.

linuxZeroToService.title: Mode B: Linux Zero-to-Service
linuxZeroToService.descriptionPrefix: This is the full from-scratch flow on Linux host. It builds binaries and lets
linuxZeroToService.descriptionSuffix: install PostgreSQL, Firecracker, rootfs images, Nova, and Lumen as systemd services.
linuxZeroToService.remoteVariant: Remote deployment variant (build locally, run setup remotely):

items.item1: Checks root permissions, Linux/x86_64, and binary artifacts.
items.item6: Installs Firecracker + Jailer and downloads Firecracker-compatible kernel.
items.item9Prefix: Builds Lumen (Next.js standalone) and deploys to
items.item11: Seeds sample functions via Nova API for initial validation.

componentRoles.title: Component Roles
componentRoles.description: Components used in the full Linux deployment and what each one does:

postgresql.role: Persists control-plane state, metadata, logs, keys, and configuration.

initDb.role: Creates tables/indexes and default records required by Nova.

novaBinary.role: Runs Nova API/control plane on port 9000.

novaAgent.role: Executed inside VM rootfs as /init to run function workloads.

firecracker.role: Provides lightweight microVM isolation for function execution.

kernel.role: Linux kernel used by Firecracker guest VMs.

lumenService.role: Runs Lumen dashboard (Next.js standalone) on port 3000.

novaService.role: Supervises Nova daemon process and restart policy.

installRoot.role: Holds binaries, configs, kernel, rootfs, snapshots, and UI bundle.

runtimeTempDir.role: Stores sockets, vsock files, and execution logs during runtime.

items.item3: Call API once to confirm function lifecycle works.

orbitAndAtlas.title: Orbit and Atlas
orbitAndAtlas.description: deploys backend and UI. Orbit CLI and Atlas MCP are built separately when needed.

items.item1: Enable auth and tenant governance before exposing APIs outside trusted networks.
items.item2: Back up PostgreSQL and verify restore procedures regularly.
items.item3: Pin Firecracker/kernel versions in controlled environments instead of floating latest.
items.item5: Set up metrics/tracing exporters and retention policy for invocation logs.
items.item6Suffix: as a re-provision operation, not an in-place upgrade.

docsMcpServerPage.title: Atlas MCP Server
docsMcpServerPage.description: Atlas exposes Nova capabilities as MCP tools so AI agents can operate Nova through a typed stdio tool interface.

overview.title: Overview
overview.descriptionPrefix: Atlas is implemented in Go and runs over MCP stdio transport. It maps Nova HTTP APIs to MCP tools with a consistent

items.item1: Automate operational runbooks from AI coding/ops assistants.
items.item2: Drive function, workflow, and event operations from natural language requests.
items.item3: Keep the same tenant/namespace scoping model as Orbit and HTTP clients.

connectionConfig.title: Connection Config
connectionConfig.description: Atlas reads backend context from environment variables and forwards them as Nova request headers.

toolSurface.title: Tool Surface
toolSurface.description: Atlas tools are grouped by domain to mirror Nova APIs.

items.functions: Functions: lifecycle, code, versions, invocation, async invocation.
items.events: Events: topics, subscriptions, deliveries, replay, outbox.
items.governance: Governance: tenants, API keys, secrets, config.
items.operations: Operations: health, stats, metrics, logs, invocations.

items.item1: Always set tenant and namespace explicitly in shared environments.
items.item2: Prefer least-privilege API keys per automation/agent workflow.
items.item3: Treat MCP tool responses as source-of-truth runtime state, not cached assumptions.
items.item4: Use replay/seek/dlq tools for controlled recovery instead of ad-hoc DB changes.

docsIntroPage.title: Introduction
docsIntroPage.description: Nova is a backend-first serverless control plane. It provides function execution, workflow orchestration, event delivery, and tenant-aware operations behind one API.

jumpToComparison.prefix: Looking for capability differences? Jump to

whoThisIsFor.title: Who This Is For
whoThisIsFor.description: This documentation is for platform engineers and backend developers who want to run Nova as a multi-tenant serverless backend and operate it with Orbit CLI.

items.item1: You need one backend API for functions, workflows, and event-driven delivery.
items.item2: You want tenant and namespace isolation at request level.
items.item3: You need local development parity with production-like operational primitives.

functionControl.label: Function runtime control
functionControl.value: Create/update/invoke functions, observe logs and metrics.

workflowOrchestration.label: Workflow orchestration
workflowOrchestration.value: Publish workflow definitions and trigger runs.

eventBus.label: Event bus
eventBus.value: Topics, subscriptions, delivery retries, replay, outbox relay.

platformGovernance.label: Platform governance
platformGovernance.value: Tenants, namespaces, quotas, API keys, secrets.

operationsTooling.label: Operations tooling
operationsTooling.value: Orbit CLI for operators and Atlas MCP server for AI tooling.

comparison.title: Control Surface Comparison
comparison.description: Nova exposes the same backend through three operation surfaces. They overlap heavily but are not identical. Use this matrix to pick the right entry point for each task.

choose.lumenDescription: you need visual inspection, quick interactive edits, and dashboard-driven troubleshooting.
choose.orbitDescription: you need full API coverage, repeatable scripts, CI/CD integration, and bulk operations.
choose.atlasDescription: you want AI agents to call typed Nova tools directly with tenant-scoped context.

functionsLifecycle.note: All three cover daily function development and operations.

workflowsLifecycle.note: Complete workflow lifecycle is available across all interfaces.

eventsLifecycle.note: End-to-end event delivery controls are available in each surface.

tenancyGovernance.note: Tenant and namespace governance is exposed everywhere.

batchAutomation.note: Lumen can operate interactively; automation is stronger with Orbit/MCP.

aiToolCalling.note: MCP is designed for agentic and assistant-driven operations.

docsMap.title: Docs Map
docsMap.description: The docs are split into guides and reference pages to match common engineering workflows.

architecture.suffix: to understand control plane vs data plane and delivery pipelines.

installation.suffix: to stand up Nova + Lumen + Orbit in your environment.

api.suffix: for request and response schemas while integrating clients.

cli.suffix: open for operational tasks and day-2 operations.

firstSmokeTest.title: First Smoke Test
firstSmokeTest.description: After deployment, run this minimal end-to-end test to verify API reachability, function lifecycle, and execution path.

testSuite.emptyDescription: 暂无测试用例。添加测试用例以验证您的函数。
testSuite.workflowEmptyDescription: 暂无测试用例。添加测试用例以验证您的工作流。
testSuite.workflowNoVersion: 此工作流尚未发布版本。请先发布版本再运行测试。
